instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2915: What is 820-2915? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.LCD_PWR_EN: What is LCD_PWR_EN? LCD_PWR_EN is a signal that tells the chip that supplies power to the LCD screen to turn on..
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> missing lcd power enable
threads.message:
I've got a couple of these <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> that have the same issue, missing <SIGNAL>LCD_PWR_EN</SIGNAL> at <CHIP>U9000</CHIP>. 
what I've checked

<RESISTOR>R9094</RESISTOR> 10k pin1 0v
<RESISTOR>R9678</RESISTOR> 4.7k pin 1 .012v pin 2 2.6v
no short to ground.

looks like I'm just not getting voltage for <SIGNAL>LCD_PWR_EN</SIGNAL> coming form <CHIP>U9600</CHIP>. Any ideas?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> missing lcd power enable
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> missing lcd power enable
threads.message: Yes it does boot and runs on external.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> missing lcd power enable
threads.message: LCD is not recognized. LCD and cable known good? <CAPACITOR>C9010</CAPACITOR> have 3V? Backlight not coming on also?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> missing lcd power enable
threads.message: <CAPACITOR>C9010</CAPACITOR> 3v is present, tested with known good screen and cable no backlight  either. could maybe be the connector?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> missing lcd power enable
threads.message:
Check pin 6 and 7 on diode mode, once with screen once without.
<SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> high?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> missing lcd power enable
threads.message:
both pins at 1.051 in diode mode with screen plugged in and 1.053 without screen. <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> 3.4V
SORRY  pin6-7 diode mode .450-.473

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> missing lcd power enable
threads.message: 1051 makes no sense. Those lines should measure a lot lower, 0.5 or 0.6 range.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> missing lcd power enable
threads.message: sorry pin 6 was .450 pin 7 .473 didn't change when i unplugged the screen

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> missing lcd power enable
threads.message: Measure if pins 4 6 7 have continuity to the other side of an LCD cable.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> missing lcd power enable
threads.message: no continuity on pin 4. 6 7 have continuity threw the cable. looks like its the connector?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> missing lcd power enable
threads.message: The cable does flip left to right on the connectors, so beep out all pins on the other side.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> missing lcd power enable
threads.message: ya i noticed that but still no continuity

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> missing lcd power enable
threads.message: Well, bad connector then, I bet someone tried to shove a 2012 cable in there.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> missing lcd power enable
threads.message: lol probably. ill change it out and report back.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> missing lcd power enable
threads.message: problem solved. thanks for running me threw the diag process. Now for the other ones.
